body:
@OpenRA/engine-hackers please review this PR.

A global IRC channel will help players communicate, organize games and tournaments, spread news, share maps...

We need to do something about player names too:
Your name can be too long:
![ircnamelength](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7704140/9062615/d04447d2-3ac3-11e5-8e04-9b139529eec9.png)
Or too short (empty):
![ircemptyname](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7704140/9062625/d8dd2d3c-3ac3-11e5-9cc2-7d0a5b506320.png)
Latter also crashes when disconnecting:

```
Tiberian Sun Mod at Version {DEV_VERSION}
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.2.9200.0)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 4.0.30319.34209
Exception of type `Meebey.SmartIrc4net.NotConnectedException`: The connection could not be disconnected because there is no active connection
   at Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcConnection.Disconnect()
   at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Widgets.Logic.IrcLogic.Disconnect()
   at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Widgets.ButtonWidget.<.ctor>b__d(MouseInput _)
   at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Widgets.ButtonWidget.HandleMouseInput(MouseInput mi)
   at OpenRA.Widgets.Widget.HandleMouseInputOuter(MouseInput mi) in OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Widgets\Widget.cs:Line 354.
   at OpenRA.Widgets.Ui.HandleInput(MouseInput mi) in OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Widgets\Widget.cs:Line 87.
   at OpenRA.DefaultInputHandler.<>c__DisplayClass7.<OnMouseInput>b__6() in OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Input\InputHandler.cs:Line 49.
   at OpenRA.Sync.CheckSyncUnchanged[T](World world, Func`1 fn) in OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Sync.cs:Line 197.
   at OpenRA.DefaultInputHandler.OnMouseInput(MouseInput input) in OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Input\InputHandler.cs:Line 49.
   at OpenRA.Renderer.Sdl2.Sdl2Input.PumpInput(IInputHandler inputHandler) in OpenRA\OpenRA.Renderer.Sdl2\Sdl2Input.cs:Line 105.
   at OpenRA.Renderer.Sdl2.Sdl2GraphicsDevice.PumpInput(IInputHandler inputHandler) in OpenRA\OpenRA.Renderer.Sdl2\Sdl2GraphicsDevice.cs:Line 359.
   at OpenRA.Graphics.Renderer.EndFrame(IInputHandler inputHandler) in OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Graphics\Renderer.cs:Line 153.
   at OpenRA.Game.RenderTick() in OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Game.cs:Line 546.
   at OpenRA.Game.Loop() in OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Game.cs:Line 653.
   at OpenRA.Game.Run() in OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Game.cs:Line 671.
   at OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args) in OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Support\Program.cs:Line 111.
   at OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args) in OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Support\Program.cs:Line 39.
```
It also throws no message if you try it with a playername containing invalid chars, e. g. space. It even shows an empty channel then, and the player won't pop up in the actual channel.
Added nickname changing and sanity checks.
Added a `/ping` command.
The game freezes when sending `{0}` or when logging in with an invalid nickname and clicking on `Disconnect` after that.
Fixed the remaining exploits and the UI threading issues. Removing my previous workarounds also improved responsiveness a lot.
Updated with the hints from @ScottNZ and @pchote.
Updated again to stay connected even after closing widgets and switching mod like the original https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/3859.

If I connect with an empty nickname and then disconnect, there is a huge lag/freeze.

Also crashes when I quit the game:

```
Tiberian Sun Mod at Version {DEV_VERSION}
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.2.9200.0)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 4.0.30319.34209
Exception of type `Meebey.SmartIrc4net.NotConnectedException`: The connection could not be disconnected because there is no active connection    
   at Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcConnection.Disconnect()
   at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Widgets.Logic.IrcLogic.Disconnect()
   at System.Action.Invoke()
   at OpenRA.Game.Run() in OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Game.cs:Line 686.
   at OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args) in OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Support\Program.cs:Line 111.
   at OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args) in OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Support\Program.cs:Line 39.
```
Fixed the crash due to invalid user name input, replaced all remaining raw message parsers with event handlers and tried to get the thread to self-eliminate.

```
OpenRA.Mods.Common/Widgets/Logic/IrcLogic.cs:L150: [SA1008] Invalid spacing around the opening parenthesis.
OpenRA.Mods.Common/Widgets/Logic/IrcLogic.cs:L155: [SA1008] Invalid spacing around the opening parenthesis.
OpenRA.Mods.Common/Widgets/Logic/IrcLogic.cs:L162: [SA1008] Invalid spacing around the opening parenthesis.

```
Fixed.
Updated with the suggested changes and fixed the nickname panel not being initialized when leaving the window without disconnecting.

I noticed the if I joined in one mod, disconnected and then set it connect automatically, that when I opened the TS mod (and it joined automatically) the user list wouldn't be updated with other users, only me.

This only seems to happen on this mod, and the list works if you disconnect and join on it usually, or if you remain connected whilst switching mods. Not sure what's up with that.

Seems to work otherwise though :)
This looks good to me, if you can fix the two code issues I commented on inline, as well as the bug from my [other comment](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/8636#issuecomment-135524404).
As I can't reproduce https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/8636#issuecomment-135524404 I assume your thread safety hints already squished that bug.

I found the problem for my issue: If the `OnJoin` and `OnChannelActiveSynced` fire within the same tick, the following happens:
- OnJoin calls SyncNicknamePanel with 1 user.
- OnChannelActiveSynced calls SyncNicknamePanel with all the users.

These both use Game.RunAfterTick to run stuff on the UI thread, but that doesn't preserve order correctly (see #9286). If they both get queued in the same tick then they get processed in reverse - you'll sync the list with all the users, then sync it with the one user.
Fixed.
:+1: Works nice.

I'm not a fan of the char limit of the nickname. I can't use two of my most common nicknames that would otherwise fit well with the UI. Other than that, it works fine so :+1: I suppose.

EDIT: I thought we were going to remove /commands entirely?

If one client dies, the other (I was testing with 2) gets this:
![](http://i.imgur.com/YqJgbQ8.png)

Which means that I can kill your game by killing mine.
Quits aren't even associated with channels, so this is hardly surprising.
The AddChatLine above that also passes two arguments to a one-parameter format string.
Fixed. The API isn't really fool proof in that regard.
The same thing happens to the Lobby and any other chat window. Our word wrap only works if you write proper words. WONTFIX for now, but you can make a ticket if it annoys you.
[Changelog](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/Changelog-%28bleed%29/_compare/e3a5d6c18616edd7d661d0d1d8dab947dd539095...5b92fb8bf6b3edc373a214327258614cff4419a3)
Good work!
@ihptru Can you also run https://github.com/ihptru/orabot at irc.openra.net #lobby now?
